poem:
**Norse Echoes**

Underneath our northern soil,  
treasures sleep in mute rehearsal,  
fingers of earth clutching coins and brooches,  
ghosts of fear wrapped in cloth.  

Now they wake in glass cases,  
Saxon gold gleaming beside Viking iron,  
echoes telling old riddles—  
how plunder and power paint history  
in shared whispers of axe and hoard.
